newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RUGBY UNION-AUSTRALIA STUN FRENCH TO CLINCH SERIES.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-AUSTRALIA STUN FRENCH TO CLINCH SERIES.

text.p: Australia stunned France with an early assault to set up a 26-19 win in the second and final rugby union test and clinch the series 2-0 on Saturday.
The Wallabies scored three tries in a blistering opening against the Five Nations champions at Ballymore to lead 17-0 inside the opening 20 minutes.
Australia, who won the first test 29-15 in Sydney a week ago, surged ahead through tries from prop Richard Harry, winger Ben Tune and centre Jason Little.
Captain and lock John Eales added three penalties and one conversion.
France replied with a try from centre Thomas Castaignede just before halftime to trail 20-13 at the interval.
Castaignede's centre partner Christophe Lamaison kicked four penalties and one conversion to keep the French in a match that was marred by ill-discipline from both sides.
His accuracy brought the touring team to within one point of the home side at 20-19 early in the second half before Eales landed two of his penalties to put the match out of France's reach.
Referee Clayton Thomas of Wales was required to warn rival captains Abdel Benazzi and Eales about their sides' conduct after several ugly clashes between the players.
In the worst incident, back rowers Troy Coker and Fabien Pelous wrestled each other to the ground before the Australian forward landed several punches to his opponent's head.
French lock Olivier Brouzet was also penalised for stamping on Wallaby flanker Brett Robinson at the fringe of a ruck just before halftime.
